item.title: Afghanistan: The desperate scramble to escape
item.description: The BBC witnesses scenes of chaos and panic as thousands still crowd Kabul's airport.

item.title: Biden warns lives could be lost in Kabul airlift
item.description: The US president is facing a firestorm of criticism for the chaotic evacuation from Afghanistan.

item.title: Nine Afghan girl robotics team members safe in Qatar
item.description: The all-girls team, known as the "Afghan Dreamers" have made headlines around the world.

item.title: Ever Given: Cargo ship returns through Suez Canal it blocked
item.description: Global trade was disrupted in March when the massive container ship became stuck in the waterway.

item.title: Afghanistan: Boris Johnson says he has full confidence in Dominic Raab
item.description: The UK foreign secretary is facing calls to quit over his handling of evacuations.

item.title: Peterborough mum back at home with baby born before Covid coma
item.description: Hajrah Aslam described being back at home with her baby as a "dream come true".

item.title: Jill Murphy: The Worst Witch and Large family author dies at 72
item.description: The children's writer and illustrator also published picture books like the Large family series.

item.title: Bournemouth boy, 13, dies of suspected drug overdose
item.description: A 14-year-old boy has been arrested after Mehmet Altun, 13, became ill in Bournemouth and died.

item.title: New visas urged to tackle EU lorry driver shortage
item.description: A lorry driver shortage is leaving shelves empty, and one group wants 10,000 EU visas granted to solve it.

item.title: Poison algae may have killed California family, police say
item.description: A family of three may have been killed by toxic algae blooms on a hiking trail, investigators say.

item.title: House prices: Demand changes, not tax waiver, pushed prices up
item.description: The stamp duty holiday did not cause rising house prices, the Resolution Foundation think tank says.

item.title: Covid: CO2 monitors pledged to aid school ventilation
item.description: Schools in England are to be given CO2 monitors to as part of plans to limit the spread of Covid.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Evacuation efforts in Kabul and Al-Qaeda warning
item.description: The continuing situation in Afghanistan dominates most of the front pages.

item.title: The West End star who worked as carer during lockdown
item.description: As theatres reopen, actors like Stephen Beckett have been swapping their lockdown jobs for their place on the stage once more.

item.title: Covid cases: This summer compared with last
item.description: Case numbers are 30 times higher than at the same point last year - where might we be heading next?

item.title: Quiz of the week: Rude place names and noisy ice-cream vans
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Syrian family in Cardigan advise Afghan refugees about Wales
item.description: The Alchikhs made Cardigan their home after spending three years in a Lebanese refugee camp.

item.title: Red phone box stolen from Cheshire garden in broad daylight
item.description: Three men used a digger to steal the phone box, belonging to Chelford Parish Council, police say.

item.title: The devastating human cost of rising gun violence in the US
item.description: Deadly shootings in many US cities are on the rise - poorer and black communities are hardest hit.

item.title: I wouldn't change anything for the world - Simone Biles
item.description: Four-time Olympic gold medallist Simone Biles "wouldn't change anything for the world" because she "gave an outlet for athletes to speak up about mental health".

item.title: Lockdown screen time sees rise in short-sightedness among children
item.description: Optometrists are diagnosing higher numbers of children with short-sightedness since the start of the pandemic.

item.title: New York officer rescues fallen man from subway train
item.description: A bystander captured the harrowing moments after a passenger fell unconscious from the platform.

item.title: Father and son from Poole cross Channel on electric boards
item.description: Rob and Morgan rode their electric hydrofoil boards non-stop from France to England.

item.title: Drag Race UK queens: Covid 'pushed us creatively'
item.description: Newsbeat has spoken to all 12 queens taking part in the new series.

item.title: Paralympics: Para-badminton player Palak Kohli on preparing for Tokyo 2020
item.description: Palak Kohli is the only Indian para-badminton player to be competing in three categories in Tokyo.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: Rescue efforts continue in Les Cayes
item.description: The death toll from the 7.2-magnitude quake is now over 2,000, with many still missing in towns like Les Cayes.

item.title: Wildfires rage across Europe
item.description: A look at some of the fires spreading across Europe - and the rest of the globe.

item.title: Nature: Rattlesnakes' sound 'trick' fools human ears
item.description: Rattlesnakes have evolved a clever method of convincing humans that danger is closer than you think.

item.title: OnlyFans: How it handles illegal sex videos - BBC investigation
item.description: Announcement came as leaked documents revealed Only Fans had some “tolerance” for accounts that posted illegal content.

item.title: Clive Myrie: Becoming host of Mastermind is a big, big job
item.description: The journalist may be feeling jittery about his new role but hopes it will reveal his lighter side.

item.title: Love and money: Why breaking-up is so hard to do
item.description: More people are looking for help in paying for divorces after relationships ended during Covid.

item.title: 'We felt free': Cubans remain defiant in face of protest crackdown
item.description: A month after rare anti-government protests in Cuba, many of those who took part remain defiant.

item.title: Aaliyah albums streaming: 'Her influence is absolutely everywhere'
item.description: Her second album, One In A Million, is streaming for the first time, 20 years after her death.

item.title: Covid career changers: ‘Do something you love’
item.description: Young people say their career prospects and businesses have taken a financial hit from Covid.

item.title: Canada election: How vaccine mandates became an issue
item.description: Liberal leader Justin Trudeau will mandate vaccines for all Canadian travellers if re-elected next month.

item.title: How virtual reality can help to recruit and train staff
item.description: VR headsets are making a leap from fun gimmick to serious tool for firms' workforce management.

item.title: Afghanistan: Calls to UK veterans mental health helpline double
item.description: Charity Combat Stress says calls to its helpline have doubled since the Taliban took control of Kabul.

item.title: Brilliant Brave thrash Rockets to reach men's Hundred final
item.description: Southern Brave thrash Trent Rockets by seven wickets in the men's Hundred eliminator to set up a final against Birmingham Phoenix.

item.title: Arsenal sign Odegaard from Real Madrid and Sheff Utd keeper Ramsdale
item.description: Arsenal complete deals for Real Madrid midfielder Martin Odegaard and Sheffield United goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale.

item.title: Stunning fightback helps Oval Invincibles storm into women's Hundred final
item.description: Oval Invincibles fight back from the brink in stunning style to reach the inaugural women's Hundred final with a 20-run win over Birmingham Phoenix.

item.title: England's Hall shares clubhouse lead in Women's Open
item.description: England's Georgia Hall continues her bid for a second AIG Women's Open title by taking a share of the clubhouse lead on day two at Carnoustie.

item.title: St Helens coast to derby win at Wigan
item.description: St Helens coast to a derby win over Wigan Warriors in a highly charged Super League fixture at the DW Stadium.

item.title: Trump out of British Open and loses number one ranking - on his birthday
item.description: Judd Trump loses in the British Open third round, surrendering the world number one ranking - on his birthday.

item.title: 'They will kill me': Desperate Afghans seek way out after Taliban takeover
item.description: Many Afghans are desperate to escape after the Taliban takeover. Some fear there is no way out.

item.title: Family of American taken by Taliban beg for return
item.description: Mark Frerichs, 59, one of the last Americans kidnapped by the Taliban, is stuck in Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghanistan: Tears and applause as UK appeal helps refugees
item.description: People in Chapel-en-le-Frith in the Peak District collected more than 1,000 bags of donations in 48 hours.

item.title: LGBT in Afghanistan: 'I could be killed on the spot'
item.description: A gay student from Kabul tells Newsbeat how life has changed under the Taliban.

item.title: The treacherous road to Kabul's airport
item.description: As thousands try to flee Afghanistan, the main route to the capital's airport has become treacherous.

item.title: Facebook moves to protect Afghan users' accounts amid Taliban takeover
item.description: The tech giant says it wants to reassure people worried about being tracked down by the Taliban.

item.title: Afghanistan: Child handed over Kabul airport wall as chaos continues
item.description: Afghans try to scale airport walls and shots are fired as crowds keep trying to flee the Taliban.

item.title: Taliban and women: Kabul university student on fears for future
item.description: A Kabul university student tells the BBC how she is wiping out all traces of her previous life.

item.title: Afghanistan: Who originally supported Trump's deal with the Taliban?
item.description: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace now calls it a "rotten" deal but supported it at the time.

item.title: Biden on Afghanistan fact-checked
item.description: How consistent is President Biden in his comments on Afghanistan?

item.title: Afghanistan: A woman's story of life under the Taliban in 1999
item.description: Taliban rule in 1999 - an Afghan woman recalls the day her father disappeared.

item.title: UK woman tells of airport dash to flee Kabul
item.description: A councillor who was visiting family in the country she had left aged three tells of her evacuation.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: How effective is the vaccine and do I need a booster?
item.description: All over-16s can get the Covid vaccine and boosters are expected to be rolled out from September.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in other parts of the UK.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: 'How I found out my dad was a best-selling sex writer'
item.description: Sara Faith Alterman was always close to her father. Then she learned he was concealing a secret.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Inside the dark world of 'incels'
item.description: Who are the angry young men who describe themselves as "involuntarily celibate"?

item.title: Wildfires: How Portuguese club Tondela drove through the flames
item.description: In Tondela, the bond between club and fans was at its strongest during the night in October 2017 when nobody slept.

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.
